title: Ninh Kieu Wharf
address: 106 ƒê∆∞·ªùng Hai B√† Tr∆∞ng, T√¢n An, Ninh Ki·ªÅu, C·∫ßn Th∆°

reviews.name: Hong Nguyen
reviews.review:
Coming to the Mekong Delta without stopping at Ninh Kieu wharf would probably be a mistake.
The feeling of sailing on the vast river really makes us satisfied.  Beautiful ‚Ä¶

reviews.name: Arun Jayaprakash
reviews.review: Visited the marina to take a boat on our way to the Cai Rang Floating Market. The place is neat and well maintained, with beautiful gardens, plants and trees, and is a nice place to spend time with a view of the river.

reviews.name: Ko Koo
reviews.review:
The floating market tour was okay... not really impressive.
If you don't have time in C·∫ßn Th∆°, you can easily pass on this tour. Typical tourist trap. ‚Ä¶

reviews.name: Tomas Hendrych
reviews.review: Be sure what you expect. There is almost no floating market any more, there are tourist floating souvenir market. We paid for private boat, had to wait 30 minutes abd finaly ended with 10 other tourist.

reviews.name: Natalia T
reviews.review: We rented a small boat for two people at 400,000 VND, which I found to be a reasonable price. Larger boats cost 100,000 VND per person and carry up to 20 people, but I don‚Äôt think they‚Äôre worth it. To get a good deal, arrive at the port by ‚Ä¶

reviews.name: David Henderson
reviews.review:
A nice area to walk through, but kind of a bummer being constantly accosted by people trying to sell you boat tickets.

FYI don't buy from any of them.

Visited during my 2024 bicycle trip around SE Asia. Watch on YouTube: @VeloObscura

reviews.name: J C
reviews.review:
The highlight of this warfare was supposed to be the boat dining experience. Sadly, the ride was short of good, and the food was mediocre at best.

Boat ride: With the expectation of a moving boat accompanying sights and views of the river, you only get about 5 minutes of the boat going. Then the boat makes a slow rotation and your headed back to base.

Music on the boat was ok. Was not the best as it only included traditional music.

Food: Orders of food was pricey. Even the sodas were pricey. The best deal you would get is ordering one of the hotpot. Anything else, don't say you weren't warned. But, to be fare, it's a tourist attraction. So pricey food is expected.

Overall, this boat dinner affair isn't good. Many things can be improved. Many things can be possible, should the owners want it better to represent Vietnam.

reviews.name: H√† Vi·ªát Th·∫Øng
reviews.review: It‚Äôs new year so there are so much lights. Very cool, very demure

reviews.name: C CLARENCE
reviews.review: Fun place to visit lot's of nice restaurant's and Bar's around. The floating market isn't much existing as I expected. Looks like it doesn't active as it used to be. But anyway you can experience what it's looks like Vietnamese culture

reviews.name: Nguyen Thanh Tam
reviews.review:
Touristic site with lots of restaurants, buildings and shops, so not spacious enough for those who like walking.
This is also a boat dock to visit the floating markets and the island so many vendors will come to offer the services as you walk by but they are polite, not try to stop or scare you. Totally understand why they have to do this, COVID time and very few guests.

reviews.name: Eric Christophe
reviews.review: Great place with garden, as a ship docking there local authorities are not very complaisant or helpful, for our guests to embark the Sampan. Can tho is a busy town with its floating market CAI RANG therefore it can be very noisy for the guests sleeping and karaoke going on late at night.

reviews.name: Dr. Stephen Bui
reviews.review: Really nice place to walk by the pier with lots of restaurants and coffee shops. The place is beautiful and made to accommodate pedestrians. Lots of restaurants on the river as well. You would have a wonderful time there for dinner and after.

reviews.name: Darren Bird
reviews.review: I truly love this place. Day or night it is spectacular. A wonderful open place for walking. All sorts of food for sale. And a bridge for lovers. Young or old you will be enamored by this place. 5 stars.

reviews.name: Thu L∆∞u
reviews.review:
I went on Saturday, the led lights are turned off, so, I can not see many things in there.
I came in October during flood season, so the streets are drowned.
I came back Nink Kieu wharf at the next morning, I can photo some pictures there.
That's an experience bad.

reviews.name: Jeff Byron
reviews.review: Quick little ferry to get across the river. Costs  4000 per person for a return trip.

reviews.name: Tu Nguyen
reviews.review: Pure Air with view, you can see Can Tho River, Hau River. You also can see Can Tho Bridge. Clean and many people visit there in the evening. But sometimes Some people ask you want to go Cai Rang Floating Market by their boats, I thought that it is too dangerous although I want to help them because they are poor. This is a good place for having a walk.

reviews.name: Ho√†ng Y·∫øn Ph√πng
reviews.review: "Ninh Kieu Wharf" is one of the most famous symbols of Can Tho City and is also a cultural symbol of the Southwest region. The  floated market usually begins at dawn, which is very bustling and crowded. They mainly sell fruits for the traders as well as many products like a normal market. It has attracted many domectic and foreign tourists come to enjoy the feeling of traveling on the river. There are some ships for rent to take you around the river to take part in the lively atmosphere of Ninh Kieu Wharf. üíú

reviews.name: Dan Nguyen
reviews.review: The city improved this place quite a bit.  I love how you take a long walk along the river.  It is dimly lit in some area,  but brighly lit in the tourist area.  There are several boats serving dinner cruise at night.  You can order food,  and they add $.50 or 10,000 dong for the cruise.  I don't like the loud music and the crowd.  I come before the cruise and eat on the boat, and get off the boat before the cruise.  You can hire a boat to take you on the opposite side of the river, to enjoy the extremly long promenade,  a good place to practice a marathon or ride your bike.

reviews.name: To Nhu Tran
reviews.review:
Welcome to Can Tho (my hometown) ü•∞
Proud of was born and grown up at here!
Wish you have a great vacation/business trip! ‚Ä¶

reviews.name: Eric D∆∞∆°ng
reviews.review: Nice and cool place at night. Maybe not so clean. There are many small boats on the quay. Rental price is just 10usd per hour sailing around the Mekong river in Can Tho

reviews.name: Loc Van Truong
reviews.review: Night walking street with variety foods and drink. Resonable price. With night market at the end, variable clothing and toy choices for adults and kids.

reviews.name: Anh Chau
reviews.review: Very clean area and fresh air. Good for morning jogging

reviews.name: –ú–∞–∫—Å–∏–º –ò–≤–æ–Ω–∏–Ω
reviews.review: A beautiful park with a promenade along the Mekong River, there are very few tourists, not far from the park in 5 minutes walk there is a large local market with cheap prices

reviews.name: HAZIZIE SIDEK
reviews.review: Beautiful View. Clean and nice walkway. Such a relaxing and good memories take photo with friends and family.

reviews.name: Olivine Thuy Phan
reviews.review: So nice, the atmosphere so nice in the morning, location veru friendly

reviews.name: Huongt Minh
reviews.review: Very famous place in Mekong Delta is B·∫øn Ninh Ki·ªÅu, located in the center of Can Tho city, Ninh Kieu district, very easy for you to find this place. You'll see Ben Ninh Kieu very dynamic in the evening, there are many food and souvenirs kiosks. Many diversified food for you to try. Beside that, you can also have many beautiful photos in the Ninh Kieu walked bridge.

reviews.name: Bill Lovett
reviews.review: I and my wife visited in an early Saturday evening. Lots of people about. Nice vibe, great futuristic  lights. Just lovely.

reviews.name: Ben Quintana
reviews.review: Open bridge across the water. Relaxing walk and nice views plus it is free to just hangout. A few restaurants around so it is a good spot to stop before or after eating.

reviews.name: Lan Anh Nguy·ªÖn
reviews.review: This is a place for relaxation at the weekend. You can bring your children, go skating, take a walk around the Ninh Ki·ªÅu harbor. There are cruises for tourists. You can book tickets first. You can go sightseeing on the cruise and enjoy the nightlife. Along the river, there are a bunch of coffee shop where you have a cup of black coffee or cold beer. If you're hungry you can wander around and find many street food venders at the food market.

reviews.name: Volkan Sakarya
reviews.review: Try to use known agencies on Marina Road. Some scammed people can approach you to sell Mekong boat tour and show their boat. Please don't take into consideration their offer even cheaper than official tour agencies.

reviews.name: Let√≠cia Usanovich
reviews.review: Great evening vibe by the river. Also great street food market in the area. You can book tours to the floating market at the pier.

reviews.name: Richard jackson
reviews.review: Nice restaurant, has a better than average drinks list, nice service and views of the boats chuggingup an down the river. Friendly staff. 100k vnd for a glass of Dalat white wine.

reviews.name: V≈© Th·ªã Kim Chi
reviews.review:
Not bad. They have night market here
And in the morning, from the left side. I can take a walk and discover some foood vegetables in the market

reviews.name: Mr. RA THA
reviews.review: Nice hotel and nice pace to visit it. It is located in Can Tho city, Mekong Delta. This is a new city in the Mekong and attracting many tourists come stay at the hotel and visit it. Close to the hotel is a Walking Bridge

reviews.name: Dazai Au
reviews.review: The park is green and clean, it is great to have a walk here in the morning and watch boats.

reviews.name: Can Pham
reviews.review: Coming to Can Tho city, this beautiful place is great to see in the evening.

reviews.name: VAN DEO NGUYEN
reviews.review: the beautiful park beside the river, most of visitor are walking along side of park and walking bridge (Can Tho's Love Bridge). But if you wanna see the whole park with light and reflection, you can take a boat to Fishing Village to see the park from other side of river

reviews.name: Nguyen Duc Nguyen
reviews.review: Clean water and fresh air morning and night. Just wonderful!

reviews.name: vu nghi nguyen
reviews.review: Beautiful place to visit...be mindful when crossing the road.

reviews.name: Robert Chase
reviews.review: Beautiful at night. Great views. Great place to bring the family at night.

reviews.name: Son Nguyen Van Thanh
reviews.review: Beautiful park, too crowded at the weekend.

reviews.name: Ryan Shady
reviews.review: Nice and happening place. You can get from street food to gourmet just by walking along the street. You can also get souvenirs or clothing at the night market, but remember to bargain. This is what Ben Thanh market and Bach Dang wharf of Sai Gon used to look and fell like 10-15 years ago

reviews.name: Anh Nhi Ta
reviews.review: Having a cup of hot tea and enjoying night scene from the high is recommended [at the hotel - but cannot remember the name, but it is opposite to the floating restaurant area). The price is not as expensive as I expected (~1.5-2USD/ cup of tea/ coffee).

reviews.name: Trung Nguyen
reviews.review: It was a nice experience. The food were good but very expressive.

reviews.name: Miroslav Lazic (Miki)
reviews.review: Central spot of Can Tho city. Nice walking area, well illuminated and clean.

reviews.name: Linh Clark
reviews.review: Crowded and not much to see.

reviews.name: Jack lee S·ª©c s·ªëng m·ªõi
reviews.review: A fun place to hang out with many activities, upstairs has billiards and archery and a very nice atmosphere, lots of choice for food and drinks! :))

reviews.name: Michael Golden
reviews.review: We had a good lunch here while touring the water ways of this area. We also visited the area by day and night. It is a good place to step of to the night market or just walk around.

reviews.name: Brian Collyer
reviews.review: Thoroughly recommend a long evening walk here. Great atmosphere, safe and convenient

reviews.name: ◊ò◊ú ◊ú◊ï◊®◊ô◊ê
reviews.review: Colorfuly lit , gentle brease . A Verity of people walking talking and enjoying the weather. We sat to eat near by to enjoy the color show of sunset

reviews.name: denise brooks
reviews.review: Interesting place to soak in Vietnamese local tourism on the water.

reviews.name: Benny T W Wong
reviews.review: Peaceful and clean park with lots of park benches. Good river view to watch boats go by.

reviews.name: francis dureza sablon
reviews.review: Can Tho City's South of Vietnam must visit place

reviews.name: Rob Deleurme
reviews.review: It's the main tourist area of cantho, boat rides and plenty of shopping and during the holiday time a beautiful collection of of flowers and culture type displays and activities.

reviews.name: Tr·∫ßn
reviews.review: Cool atmosphere, except for the rat, it tries to eat my bottom, but everything else is fine.

reviews.name: Ho Ngoc Tin
reviews.review: So colorful at night. Crowded. Nice place!

reviews.name: James O Mahony
reviews.review: Nice litre oasis with an impressive statue of Ho Chi Minh. A nicely tended garden and a pedestrian bridge

reviews.name: Thanh Cao
reviews.review: Well come to Vietnam my lovely home town guys

reviews.name: tchongi nguyen
reviews.review: A walking alley for night sightseeing in C·∫ßn Th∆°, nothing unforgettable unfortunately

reviews.name: Derek Williamson
reviews.review: Good place to pick up a boat

reviews.name: Khairul Hazrin Hashim
reviews.review: Nice scenary at dawn and dusk.. nice place to chill out

reviews.name: Vuong Nguyen An
reviews.review: A place to visit at night. Amazing!

reviews.name: Joseph Sullivan
reviews.review:
Expect to spend about 3 hours in the floating market, and we arrived around 5 am. The smaller boats will approach you mostly with fresh fruits. Sometimes they will have hot coffee, tea, or bun boa. Always break one open to verify the meat was cooked through.

There‚Äôs some larger boats that you can board with mini markets. Other larger boats will line the shores and may have restrooms and a small dining area.

For the best experience, doc at one of the tourist ports for hot food and restrooms. The floating market is a great experience.

reviews.name: l√™ ƒë√¨nh thi·ªán
reviews.review: Ok

reviews.name: Erica Bailey
reviews.review:
Great gardens well maintained.
Lots of shade as we walked up to Lovers Bridge.
Well worth a visit on the vast river in Can Tho.

reviews.name: Lian Chengyuan
reviews.review:
Decent walk to experience how the locals chill. (the locals really love to karaoke, ha). The street food is interesting, esp if you take your time to look first.

Went later at night, so unable to take those boat rides. On second time, maybe it's a blessing in disguise. Not that they are bad, just that, they look and feel like just another boat ride.

reviews.name: Kenny G
reviews.review: One of the most fantastic 2-3 km walks in all of Vietnam. Whether at dawn or dusk, it never gets old and there's a lot of nice sights along the path. Do come at night when everything is lit up beautifully. Great town and this is one of the highlights.

reviews.name: Ai Fu CHIN
reviews.review: Visit day and evening for different scenery.

reviews.name: Kevin H. Nguyen
reviews.review: Great place and love the night market...

reviews.name: Douglas Page
reviews.review: Interesting to see how daily life is for locals..

reviews.name: Sujita Balami
reviews.review: Very good place to go and hang out with friends. Or couples can also enjoy in this peaceful place.

reviews.name: M. HBart
reviews.review:
Nice wharf but COVID-19 remnants are visible. We visited toward the end of raining season, hence there were not many foreign tourists. Businesses are trying to open back up slowly while others are still closed or went out of business.
Visitors can take boat tours to the floating market to watch local traders go about their business daily or to visit local fish üêü farm.

reviews.name: J DN
reviews.review:
An enjoyable walk by the river.

Highly recommend early morning and late and night.

reviews.name: Qu·ª≥nh Mai L√™ Th·ªã
reviews.review: Ok

reviews.name: Jeff Teh
reviews.review: Good to hangout at night in Can Tho

reviews.name: Aaron d
reviews.review: Lovely park . Enjoy a pleasant walk along the river and a great newish bridge festooned with lights. Very.popular with Vietnamese locals and tourists taking a stroll or relaxing on the many benches. Great for taking selfies and holiday photos.

reviews.name: Trung Nguyen Viet
reviews.review: Nothing special abt this place. There is long park along the wharf, make it nice to walk. There's a restaurant & coffee boat docking at the Wharf where u can enjoy some food & drink by the river.

reviews.name: Bach Nguyen
reviews.review: Peaceful and beautiful. Should come here

reviews.name: Th√†nh Ph·∫°m
reviews.review: Great!

reviews.name: Shark Hunter
reviews.review: A good place to visit to see the floating markets. My advice is go with a local and hire your own boat. Its a great place to see real Can Tho life. The ladies who sell their food are generally happy to see foreigners and will smile if you are friendly.

reviews.name: Khang Thanh D∆∞∆°ng
reviews.review: Such a nice place to walk and enjoy peaceful landscape of Can Tho province.

reviews.name: fc looi
reviews.review: Room seems to be recently refurbished but the toilet is a let down. Poor water pressure and the shower is broken. Ask about the room if it's close to their karaoke. The room I had was close  and the karaoke was blasting away during the day. Luckily it was quiet the night I was there. It's close to a shopping centre and waterfront.

reviews.name: Andrew Dinh
reviews.review: It's a fun place to walk around and chow down on snack food.  There is a little night market inside that you can browse around.   There were a couple floating restaurants that I could see.  There are souvenir shops inside.   It costs 40,000 Dong a car to park in their parking area.

reviews.name: Harry Nguyen
reviews.review: Prime spot for tourists and local to hang out. Lots of restaurants, cafes, food stalls, and shops. You can take a dinner/Vietnamese music show boat tour to see the town from the river, or you can take a mini sampan boat tour from one of the piers from the local people. They usually charge 50k VND/person/hour. The sampan can accommodate up to 6 guests, but to be comfortable, 4 is max.

reviews.name: Ngoc Quang Dang
reviews.review: Joyous promenade in Mekong delta

reviews.name: Marcel Cybon
reviews.review: It is not relaxing for a stroll as you are bothered constantly by very pushy touts. Not worth to come to stroll around. Other areas of town with less tourists and touts are much better.

reviews.name: Jean Pierre Jacobs
reviews.review: Visiting the market on the Mekong Delta river.

reviews.name: Ngocminh Doan
reviews.review: Beautiful scenery. They ban vehicle traffic every Saturday night and holds event there, highly recommend visiting on Saturday nights.

reviews.name: Lars
reviews.review: Not much to see. Mainly an promenade by the riverside

reviews.name: Hang Nguyen
reviews.review: I think Ninh Kieu Pier is a long-lasting and attractive tourist site in Can Tho with poetic landscapes and favorable position near Hau River. This is a attractive symbol of Can Tho that I really love to come every time I visit this city. It has beautiful views with comfortable atmosphere and the wind from Hau river. The decoration is nice. If you finish the road along Hau river side you will pass by Victoria Hotel. It is a long walking but worth to do.

reviews.name: Henrik Snellman
reviews.review: Pretty nice riverside park

reviews.name: MinhBao Bui
reviews.review: Can i help u. If u don't want to be out of money

reviews.name: vinh tran
reviews.review: Nothing special.

reviews.name: Jacopo
reviews.review: This riverside walk is barely pleasent. Vietnam clearly loves these trash led lights and place them everywhere making me feel quite unconfortable. The bridge at the end of the shack is the major example.

reviews.name: Tue Nguyen Phuoc
reviews.review:
Great for a walk and enjoy life of the locals around. Get even further down to a market for tourist to discover more local specialities.
Beware of guys who try to pursuade you to buy erotic massage services. It is illegal. Only go ahead if you are with a local who knows all tricks around.

reviews.name: Sophie Hunt
reviews.review: As a tourist interest spot, I'd recommend finding your way to the statue. It's a large statue of ho chi Minh and the area is well kept, very nice walk along the quay.

reviews.name: Vira Glushchenko
reviews.review: Good place for evening walk

reviews.name: DiemThuy Huynh
reviews.review: Food not nice and the price quite expensive.

reviews.name: Kh√°nh Thi ƒê·∫∑ng
reviews.review: Colorful place. Worth to take a trip.

reviews.name: Tran May
reviews.review: So noisy n crowded on weeken. So great view at Ninh Kieu river. Night market around there. You can loooking everything you want.

reviews.name: Hans van Rijsewijk
reviews.review: Very nice hotel, clean spacious rooms. Nicely located near the old district (Just 5 mins walk)

reviews.name: Louis Pham
reviews.review: Good place for walking

reviews.name: Jane Fahlman
reviews.review: A nice little park to find some shade and a cool breeze. As with many vietnamese parks, wifi is free and readily available.

reviews.name: Diana U
reviews.review: Love it. Love it. Beautiful place to rest and relax and enjoy the scene. But not at the weekend. Too many people there. It was too crowded. Go there weekdays to hangout.

reviews.name: Gavin Brown
reviews.review:
Nice tourist attraction.
Well frequented by the locals as well.
Best to go at night to see all the pretty lights

reviews.name: C S
reviews.review: Very busy vietnamese market street. The food is amazing. If you are in C·∫ßn Th∆° you should definitely go there in the evening.

reviews.name: Riki Hiagari
reviews.review: Love it

reviews.name: Khanh Tuan TRAN
reviews.review: Nice park

reviews.name: Vinh Tran
reviews.review: Pretty great place to go for a walk near the night market! My parents says it reminds them of their childhood !

reviews.name: Th·∫≠p Tam H·∫Øc
reviews.review: Good place for a walk at night ·ªãn Can Tho. Parking cost 10k for motorcycle

reviews.name: Thang Tran
reviews.review: Beautiful park. The place is near the Can Tho river with many boats. Tourists can ask the tour guide a tour with boats.

reviews.name: Joshua Fitzpatrick
reviews.review: It's pretty to walk along the riverside here, and it's quite lively at night time

reviews.name: Hyungnyoon Yoo
reviews.review:
B·∫øn Ninh Ki·ªÅu ( Ninh Kieu Pier / Wharf )  ;

Ninh Kieu Pier is situated on the right bank of Hau River, between the junction of Hau River and Can Tho River. This pier is adjacent to Hai Ba Trung Street, Tan An Ward in Ninh Kieu District of Can Tho City.

reviews.name: L√™ MiNh T√¢m
reviews.review: Ok

reviews.name: Tris R (BrokeBritinParis)
reviews.review: Nice Park by the side of the river, surrounded by local businesses. You may get touted for a boat tour but they take no for an answer.

reviews.name: Duong Rinoa
reviews.review: Long time i didn't go to this place and It's quite crowded now! Lovers, friends moreover, I saw a lot of people catching pokemon go

reviews.name: Asher de Silva
reviews.review: A great place to just relax and enjoy the evening or take a quiet stroll down the lit up streets and walkways. Plenty of street food, bars and coffee shops to chose from.

reviews.name: Dam Tran Thanh
reviews.review: This place is one of the must-to-go in CT. Located in the center of the city and along a river. Nice place!

reviews.name: Ric
reviews.review: Cozy place at night, great for a walk and next to a walking street. Several restaurants and caphes aroung

reviews.name: Kelsey
reviews.review: Gorgeous place! Recommend a visit

reviews.name: Karis Phuong Do
reviews.review: Nice place to walk with friends or someone special, especially in the twilight. See the river, see the people, and taste the food.

reviews.name: Vinnie Food & Travel Vietnam
reviews.review: Great place to walk with your half

reviews.name: Rhys SmeathThomas
reviews.review: Quite busy at night, especially with the night markets nearby.

reviews.name: Long Phan
reviews.review: Good light at night

reviews.name: T√ÇM VƒÇN L√ä

reviews.name: Xuan Tran
reviews.review: The heart city of Mekong delta

reviews.name: ‰∫éËÖæÈ£û
reviews.review: Very nice place!

reviews.review: Ok

reviews.review: Ok

reviews.name: Loc Le
reviews.review: A must visit place in can tho VN. Very fun at night. Has many restaurants, street food, and night market

reviews.name: David Sinclair
reviews.review: Surprisingly attractive riverside. Recently renovated and a real promenade in the evenings. Go and watch the world go by.

reviews.name: T. ƒê·∫°t Phan (MD)
reviews.review: Beautiful landscape with romantic river, fresh park and great nearby street cuisine! 4 stars

reviews.name: Joe N
reviews.review: Fun place to stroll or border one of the floating restaurants (cruise).

reviews.name: Yan Ruan
reviews.review: Beautiful place for walking at night

reviews.review: A great place to hang out with your beloved ones. Food and drinks are offered at good prices.

reviews.review: Impressive neons and nice sights, busy at night

reviews.name: frank Rudd
reviews.review: Best view at high while you visit can tho City

reviews.name: 74G1 √öts
reviews.review:
The impression here is that there are quite a lot of Chinese people. There is a quite busy market, I didn't ask the price so I don't know what the prices of the items here are.
In the evening, there is a walking street with many houses built a long time ago, creating an ancient feeling. It's like getting lost in buildings like in a Hong Kong movie.

Nowadays, the wharf is mainly used for tourism purposes, but there is rarely any commercial space like before. I heard people here say that in the past, when there was no urbanization, it was much more fun.

This is a place that when you come to Can Tho, I think you should definitely visit to experience and feel.

#Utdiconquered 13 western provinces
#Ut74G1visit

reviews.name: John Cashew Machine
reviews.review:
The reason this place is famous is the boat wharf.
Here, many boats gather in all directions: go to the dunes, go to the market, go sightseeing on the river, see Can Tho bridge...
Near the marina, there is an ancient temple that also attracts tourists and local visitors
Crowded shops are also a plus point
Along the marina is a walking street with many western dishes...

Unfortunately, I have to point out this problem once again: the waste is simply left lying around somewhere. You can see the result in my photos, which I actually hate taking.

reviews.name: Ng∆∞·ªùi tr·∫£i nghi·ªám Tr√≠ D≈©ng -Follow TD
reviews.review:
CAM THI GIANG-BEN NINH KIEU-HANG DUONG Wharf
‚ÄúCan Tho has Ninh Kieu wharf
There is a beautiful river with many beautiful women.

Ninh Kieu Wharf, now known as Ninh Kieu Park, is a water wharf and a tourist and cultural landmark of Can Tho city formed in the 19th century. Ninh Kieu Wharf is located on the right bank of Hau River, between the confluence of Hau River and Can Tho River, adjacent to Hai Ba Trung Street, Tan An Ward, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City.

Ninh Kieu wharf is a long-standing tourist destination and attracts tourists because of its charming river scenery and favorable location overlooking the Hau river. Ninh Kieu wharf has long become a symbol of poetic beauty. on the banks of Hau River in Can Tho City, attracting many tourists to visit and engage in poetry:
‚ÄúCan Tho has Ninh Kieu wharf
There is a beautiful river with many beautiful women."

1Ô∏è‚É£HISTORY
There are no historical documents clearly recording the formation of Ninh Kieu Wharf, but according to some researchers, there are anecdotes about the formation of this place from the Gia Long Dynasty of the Nguyen Dynasty and that Ninh Kieu Wharf was originally a river wharf. at the beginning of Can Tho market. In addition, Hang Duong wharf is another name of Ninh Kieu known since ancient times. People here still talk about it today

Accordingly, before he became king, Nguyen Anh went to the South. One day, his boat followed the Hau River into the capital city of Tran Giang (formerly Can Tho). As night fell, the boat group just arrived at the river, Ben Ninh Kieu wharf today. In the middle of the night, there were many recitations of poetry, singing, the sounds of guitars and flutes. He praised the river for its charming landscape and named the river Cam Thi river.

Near Ninh Kieu wharf there is Can Tho market, a large trading center in the Southwest region. The river wharf is always crowded with ships and boats moving back and forth filled with products from the Mekong Delta. Standing on Ninh Kieu wharf, you can see the largest cable-stayed bridge in Can Tho, Can Tho bridge, as well as looking towards Xom Chai and towards Con Au at the beginning of the wharf, you will see a strip of isle with many trees, and if you stand from the side Looking over at Xom Chai, you will see a panoramic view of Ninh Kieu and its streets. Currently around. The wharf has aquatic restaurants, floating markets on the river, restaurants with specialty dishes...And this is the starting point to visit another famous landmark of Can Tho, Cai Rang floating market, about 0.5km. Also at Ninh Kieu Wharf, besides tourism and cultural activities, this place is bustling with trading activities and the livelihood of poor workers.

2Ô∏è‚É£Walking street and night market
On January 10, 2016, the walking, culinary and night market area at Ninh Kieu wharf, Can Tho city officially came into operation. The project is invested by Dia Cau Trading and Services Limited Liability Company with a budget of more than 4.5 billion VND. The walking and culinary street will stretch about 200m from the International Hotel to the intersection of Ngo Quyen, Hai Ba Trung, Nguyen Thai Hoc - Vo Van Tan and ends at the Old Market House area (Tan An ward, district Ninh Kieu). The night market includes food areas, night market areas and souvenir sales areas. This night market operates from 4:00 p.m. the previous day to 4:00 a.m. the next day.

3Ô∏è‚É£Tourist walking bridge
On February 6, 2016 (ie the 28th of the Lunar New Year), Can Tho city's first tourist pedestrian bridge was inaugurated, attracting a large number of people and tourists to enjoy after nearly a year of construction.

The bridge spans Khai Luong canal, connecting Ninh Kieu wharf and Cai Khe islet, made of semi-permanent reinforced concrete, nearly 200 m long, 7.2 m wide, with a total investment of nearly 50 billion VND. The bridge's surface is designed with a stylized curving S shape symbolizing the country. At the two extended bridge sections, there are two lotus flower stands. The bridge is equipped with a system of colored LED lights controlled according to different scenarios, creating a vivid and modern beauty. The system of trees and flower beds outside the railing on the bridge wall is automatically watered and drained for convenient maintenance.

reviews.name: Luong Tri
reviews.review:
A short business trip to Can Tho, although the time was short, I still tried to experience all the suggested places.
1. Night market - Ninh Kieu wharf: maybe because it's far from SG and it's in the middle of the week, not during the tourist season, so I feel deserted and peaceful => like this feeling.
2. While walking at the night market, I met a friend who advised me on floating market tickets from the Tu An shipyard => Completely by accident but highly appreciated:
- Dedicated consulting
- enthusiasm
- The ticket price is 100k but the train costs less than 20 but only has 4 tour guides. The two people in the photo are Huy - Hien (the other photo is me and my friend)
- Buying some fruits at the floating market is called experiencing the river.
- Everyone, please note that you should leave early around 5:00 am. They told me to leave before 5:30 am, but when I came out at 5:20 am, they expected only us to go (we came out early üò≥)

reviews.name: Thy H∆∞∆°ng Ph·∫°m V≈©
reviews.review:
Can Tho Market Complex - Can Tho Night Market - Ninh Kieu Wharf

Park the car at the coopmart and walk to the night market. The evening is cool, the lights are quite beautiful. Visit the night market to buy sticky rice with chicken and young eggs like a tiktok review. If there are many cars, stop by. On the opposite side of the street, there are advertising vehicles crowded with buyers. The price of sticky rice seems to be 45-55k/big box for 2 people, 5k/ball of foxglove, 10k-15k/piece of kimsa dumplings.

After buying, bring the stone benches to Ninh Kieu wharf to eat and admire the scenery. There are cruise ships on the river, the menu is a bit high (drinks 110k-140k, hotpot 3xx-400k...). After buying water, sitting on a chill cruise is fine. There should be one trip in the evening around 7:00 a.m. - 7:30 p.m

At the beginning of Can Tho market, there was a stall selling anime models. My lover was there struggling to choose for 2 hours. I saw a lot of young men coming in to choose. When buying, remember to pay the price because the seller quotes a fake price. After asking the price, be careful not to miss out.

In the evening, take a cool tour of the city center and then return to your room to rest. Only had 1 night in Can Tho so I didn't experience many places.

A verse that captivates listeners about a famous place, in the busiest and most developed city in the Mekong Delta and beyond... The beauty of the land of white rice and clear water truly deserves its name. capital of the western region, urban area of the river region. This is a tourist destination that attracts both domestic and foreign tourists to visit. There's nothing more to say, when everything around meets your expectations. If I have a chance, I will still come back to visit this place, it's worth staying for a few days to visit this city‚ù§Ô∏è

The day I went, there were only 2 people (including the boat) and each person cost 150k, so I didn't have to pair up with anyone so I felt very comfortable. Besides, I still got all the places. The small boat runs slower than the boats of other groups. Although it's a bit slow, it's a great experience on the river. Here is my phone number for everyone to contact: 039607209

reviews.name: Thu·ª≥ D∆∞∆°ng L√™
reviews.review:
Coming to Can Tho, tourists should visit Ninh Kieu wharf.

I booked a hotel right nearby so walking there at night was very cool. Along the way, they often sell traditional items, lots of food and cheap prices.

In the morning, I went from 5am to Ninh Kieu wharf to get on the motorboat to go to Cai Rang floating market. Price 100k/person, travel to about 2-3 places such as having breakfast on a boat, visiting a noodle village, experiencing making noodles and rice paper, then going around to buy fruit.

When I went this month, I saw that around the floating market there were mainly watermelons, pineapples... and mangoes were sold for 80k/kg, big fruits, sweet to eat, but I didn't buy them.

The price of the floating market boat trip can be booked separately or together depending on the negotiated price and the destination. Price does not include breakfast on the river, and purchasing souvenirs.

reviews.name: Strom Jack
reviews.review:
Ninh Kieu Wharf is one of the prominent and characteristic places of Can Tho city. Located on the gentle Hau River, this place is not only a tourist attraction but also an ideal relaxing space for both tourists and local people.
I visited the wharf in the evening, when the city started to light up. The atmosphere here is very pleasant, the river breeze blows coolly, creating a feeling of relaxation. Walking along the river, I saw many people strolling, exercising and chatting loudly. Along the wharf, there are many restaurants with all kinds of delicious Western dishes, especially fresh seafood dishes and typical fish sauce hotpot.
A big plus is that the cruise ship terminal is very busy. If you have time, you can take a boat trip on the river, sightseeing and enjoying amateur music. However, during rush hour, the station is quite crowded so it is sometimes a bit noisy and difficult to find an ideal seat. In addition, some areas still have garbage, which needs to be improved to preserve the beauty of the landscape.
However, Ninh Kieu Wharf is still a destination worth visiting if you want to feel the beauty of Can Tho at night. A place that is both simple and romantic!

reviews.name: Men Nguyen

reviews.name: L∆∞·ª£ng Thi√™n X√≠ch (L∆∞·ª£ng Thi√™n X√≠ch)
reviews.review:
With its peaceful and poetic beauty in the modern city of Can Tho, Ninh Kieu wharf is considered a cultural symbol of Tay Do. This place has a strong Southern identity and is associated with the image of boats on the river bustling with buying and selling at the floating market.

This wharf is located on the right bank of Hau River, in Tan An ward, Ninh Kieu district, Can Tho city. It is located between the confluence of Hau River and Can Tho River, so it was once considered a goods trading dock during the French colonial period. Until now, people have not found any official documents recording the history of this location. Just know that according to an anecdote, this place used to be a river wharf at the beginning of Can Tho market.

reviews.name: HAO LE HUU
reviews.review: Ninh Kieu wharf at night has a walking street and business activities, cuisine, music for children and youth, Cai Luong stage, river tour services by boat... quite diverse, typical and effective. If you increase street decoration and space for organizing activities, it will be very good. However, we must acknowledge the efforts of the local government and people to maintain and implement the current situation to meet the needs of tourists.

reviews.name: S kim
reviews.review:
If you go around 5 a.m., you can purchase floating market tour package tickets on-site (much cheaper than Klook).
The Cai Rang Floating Market + Visiting a Rice Noodle Making Shop (?) package costs 100,000 dong.
There is also an allocated time for pho meals, but you have to pay a separate fee. The rice noodles are amazingly delicious. Fruits are cheaper and more diverse than in Ho Chi Minh, so it is better to buy a lot here.
After eating, I went to see a place that makes pho, but it was small in the corner of what looked like a shopping center, so it felt like I was visiting a shopping center on a package tour. The atmosphere is not forced, but you stay for quite a while.
1 bowl of rice noodles 45,000 dong
1 coconut 25,000 dong
Longan 1kg 40,000 dong
Longan 1.5kg 50,000 dong

reviews.name: Thanh ƒêo√†n Mai
reviews.review:
Ninh Kieu Wharf, now known as Ninh Kieu Park, is a water wharf and a tourist and cultural landmark of Can Tho city formed in the 19th century. Ninh Kieu Wharf is located on the right bank of Hau River, between the confluence of Hau River and Can Tho River, adjacent to Hai Ba Trung Street, Tan An Ward, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho City.

Ninh Kieu Wharf is a long-standing tourist destination and attracts tourists because of its charming river scenery and favorable location overlooking the Hau River.[1][2] For a long time, Ninh Kieu Wharf has become a symbol of the poetic beauty on the banks of the Hau River of the entire Can Tho City, attracting many tourists to visit [3] and engage in poetry.

reviews.name: L∆∞u TR·∫¶N
reviews.review: Ninh Kieu wharf is one of the most beautiful and sparkling tourist destinations to visit at night. There are many places for you and your friends to take photos at night and during the day for free. The food in that area is also very delicious, especially the sour soup with sesbania fish, from July to October the fish is soft, the sweet soup is fragrant and crispy. These days, the roads are expanding a number of routes near the night market, so people go a bit. I'm sure next time will be fine.
